intro: Leichhardtia rara, commonly known as the rare leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
